channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2012 The New York Times Company

item.title: President Morsi in Egypt Seizes New Powers
item.description: With a constitutional assembly near collapse, President Mohamed Morsi granted himself broad powers above any court and ordered the retrial of his predecessor, Hosni Mubarak.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and MAYY EL SHEIKH
item.media:description: President Mohamed Morsi’s actions set off stark accusations that he might become a new strongman.

item.title: Hopes Fade for Quick Deal on European Union Budget
item.description: Leaders resumed talks on a trillion-euro budget for the European Union on Friday, but played down expectations of a resolution before the weekend as divisions lingered on where cuts should be applied.
item.dc:creator: By JAMES KANTER and ANDREW HIGGINS

item.title: Pigeon Code Baffles British Cryptographers
item.description: Britain’s code-breakers acknowledged on Friday that an encrypted message from World War II, found on the leg of a long-dead carrier pigeon, has thwarted all their efforts.
item.dc:creator: By ALAN COWELL

item.title: IHT Rendezvous: Endangered and Targeted: Fight to Save Oriental Stork Captivates China
item.description: In a country where citizens and conservationists alike are used to tales of damage to the environment and wildlife, the story of a massacre of migratory birds has sparked a call for change.
item.category: International Union for Conservation of Nature
item.dc:creator: By DIDI KIRSTEN TATLOW
item.media:description: An oriental white stork spreads its wings before being released into the wild on Nov. 22 by rescuers, who saved it after it was poisoned.

item.title: IHT Rendezvous: IHT Quick Read: Nov. 23
item.description: News, arts and sports in today's International Herald Tribune.
item.dc:creator: By INTERNATIONAL HERALD TRIBUNE
item.media:description: An Israeli missile is launched from a battery. Officials said their antimissile system shot down 88 percent of all assigned targets.

item.title: Israeli Troops Kill a Palestinian in Shooting That Tests Cease-Fire
item.description: Nine other Palestinians were wounded in a clash with Israeli soldiers in the Gaza Strip, health officials said, a day after wild celebrations of Hamas’s truce with Israel.
item.dc:creator: By JODI RUDOREN and ISABEL KERSHNER
item.media:description: Gaza City residents celebrated the cease-fire, which ended the eight days of conflict but did not resolve many underlying issues.

item.title: IHT Rendezvous: Anti-Semites Blamed for Rome Soccer Attack
item.description: A vicious attack in Rome left 10 fans of England's Tottenham Hotspurs soccer team wounded. The assault, blamed on anti-Semitic racists, came at a time when the London club is debating how to celebrate its Jewish connections.
item.dc:creator: By HARVEY MORRIS
item.media:description: The wreckage of a Rome bar that was attacked by hooligans on Thurday.

item.title: Letter from Europe: A French Province That Won't Be Tamed
item.description: Corsica, an island of 305,000 people about 175 kilometers off the French coast, is still under the thrall of an old legacy of vengeance and death.
item.dc:creator: By CELESTINE BOHLEN

item.title: Military Analysis: For Israel, Gaza Conflict Is Test for an Iran Confrontation
item.description: Israel’s exchange with Hamas was something of a practice run for any future armed face-off with Iran, featuring improved rockets that can reach Jerusalem and new antimissile systems to counter them.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID E. SANGER and THOM SHANKER
item.media:description: An Israeli missile is launched from a battery. Officials said their antimissile system shot down 88 percent of all assigned targets.

item.title: India Ink: Delhi Teen Slain After Confronting Man Urinating in Public
item.description: A 17-year-old was shot by her irate neighbor.
item.dc:creator: By RAKSHA KUMAR

item.title: Veto Threats Hinder E.U. Budget
item.description: Mark Rutte, the prime minister of the Netherlands, suggested delaying any final decision until next year rather than stretching the talks over the weekend and risking a failure to reach agreement.
item.dc:creator: By JAMES KANTER and ANDREW HIGGINS

item.title: India Ink: Meet 'Virtual Modi,' Gujarat Chief Minister's Latest Tech Push
item.description: A 3-D, holographic image of the chief minster drew big crowds.
item.dc:creator: By HARESH PANDYA

item.title: Berlin Journal: Berlin Tour Raises Awareness on Lobbying
item.description: A walking tour in Berlin tries to raise awareness of lobbying in Germany, a country with a low tolerance for money in politics.
item.dc:creator: By NICHOLAS KULISH
item.media:credit: Gordon Welters for The New York Times
item.media:description: Timo Lange, right, a campaigner for LobbyControl, with his tour group at the building in Berlin that houses the tobacco lobby.

item.title: Judge’s Ruling in Qaeda Terror Case Open Ideology Debate
item.description: A judge said three Malian men who agreed to ship drugs to support Al Qaeda were motivated by money, prompting speculation about the impact on similar cases.
item.dc:creator: By BENJAMIN WEISER

item.title: Move to Improve Relations With Iran Angers Jews in Argentina
item.description: Jewish leaders have been angered by moves to improve ties with Iran, accused of shielding people who prosecutors in Argentina say authorized a 1994 attack on a community center in Buenos Aires.
item.dc:creator: By SIMON ROMERO
item.media:description: Argentine prosecutors suspect Iran of shielding guilty parties in the bombing of a Jewish center in Buenos Aires that killed 85.

item.title: India Ink: Wal-Mart's India Venture Suspends Executives Amid Bribery Investigation
item.description: Bharti Walmart suspends senior officials as it investigates alleged violations of U.S. anti-bribery laws.
item.dc:creator: By THE NEW YORK TIMES

item.title: With Cease-Fire Joy in Gaza, Palestinian Factions Revive Unity Pledges
item.description: Palestinians erupted in celebrations, vowing unity among rival factions and a commitment to resistance, while Israel sought to soberly sell its military operation to a domestic audience.
item.dc:creator: By JODI RUDOREN and ISABEL KERSHNER
item.media:description: Gaza City residents celebrated the cease-fire, which ended the eight days of conflict but did not resolve many underlying issues.

item.title: Way of the World: Opportunity Missed in U.S. Bailout?
item.description: For at least one economist, the stimulus dollars would have been better spent in helping out the underwater homeowners who were behind the spending cutbacks that have made the recession so deep.
item.category: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp (Freddie Mac)
item.dc:creator: By CHRYSTIA FREELAND | REUTERS

item.title: Police Arrest Suspects in Tel Aviv Bus Blast, Including Israeli Citizen
item.description: An Arab with Israeli citizenship and several West Bank Palestinians have been arrested on suspicion of carrying out the bus bombing in Tel Aviv on Wednesday, according to security officials.
item.dc:creator: By ISABEL KERSHNER

item.title: World Briefing | Asia: The Philippines: China’s Passport Map Sets Off Protest
item.description: The Philippines has protested China’s decision to issue passports containing a map that marks Chinese territorial claims in a maritime dispute with Southeast Asian nations.
item.category: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
item.dc:creator: By REUTERS

item.title: World Briefing | Europe: France: Sarkozy Questioned Over Campaign Funds
item.description: Former President Nicolas Sarkozy was put under caution as a witness who could face charges related to accusations that his 2007 election campaign received illegal donations.
item.dc:creator: By STEVEN ERLANGER

item.title: Criminal Court Issues Arrest Warrant for Simone Gbagbo
item.description: The International Criminal Court said in its warrant that Simone Gbagbo, the wife of Laurent Gbagbo, the Ivory Coast strongman, played a central role in postelection violence in 2010 and 2011.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: By ADAM NOSSITER
item.media:description: Simone Gbagbo is accused of crimes against humanity that took place in postelection violence in Ivory Coast in 2010 and 2011.

item.title: Syrian Airstrike Severely Damages Hospital in Aleppo
item.description: A government attack flattened a building next to one of the few functioning medical facilities in Syria’s largest city early on Thursday, killing at least 15 people, activists said.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By ANNE BARNARD and HANIA MOURTADA
item.media:description: A boy cleaned debris outside Dar el-Shifa hospital in Aleppo, damaged by a Syrian airstrike.

item.title: Inquiry Sought in Death in Ireland After Abortion Was Denied
item.description: The death of an Indian-born woman has focused international attention on the Irish ban on abortion.
item.dc:creator: By DOUGLAS DALBY

item.title: Reporter’s Notebook: Life in Gaza Courtyards: Shows of Pride and Sacrifice
item.description: Behind the scenes of destruction, mourning women talk of victory in death and idle young men laugh off bombings.
item.dc:creator: By JODI RUDOREN
item.media:description: Residents of Gaza City peered Thursday at the rubble left by Israeli airstrikes. Some paraded through the streets claiming victory.
